clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of FDG-PET/CT on Management of Patients With Native Valve Infective Endocarditis
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of FDG-PET/CT on Management of Patients With Native Valve Infective Endocarditis

brief_summary.textblock: The proposed study is a multicentric prospective observational cohort study of patients with suspected NVE. The study population includes those with Possible IE according to the modified Duke criteria and investigated at one of the 6 participating sites which include 2 cardiac centers, the MHI and the IUCPQ, as well as 4 tertiary care centers, the Jewish General Hospital , the McGill University Health Centre and the CHUS.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with Possible IE that will be appropriately reclassified
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with Possible IE that will be appropriately reclassified as Definite IE by the addition of FDG-PET to the Duke criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity, specificity, and accuracy of FDG-PET for the detection of NVE
Sensitivity, specificity, and accuracy of the Duke criteria with FDG-PET for detection of NVESensitivity, specificity, and accuracy of the Duke criteria with FDG-PET for detection of NVE
Sensitivity, specificity, and accuracy of the Duke criteria with FDG-PET but excluding TEE for the detection of NVE
Differences in maximal standardized uptake value (SUVmax) between infected and non-infected valves
Differences target-to-background ratio (TBR) between infected and non-infected valves
Proportion of patients in whom a TEE was not necessary to diagnose NVE through the addition of FDG-PET
Proportion of patients with final diagnosis of IE with septic emboli detected on whole body FDGPET
Differences in the rate of sub-optimal suppression protocol between males and females
Proportion of patients with incidental cancer identified on FDG-PET

other_outcome.measure: Correlation between the diagnostic accuracy and available demographic, technical, and clinical factors
other_outcome.description: Correlation between the diagnostic accuracy (false-negative/false-positive studies versus truenegative/true-positive) and the available demographic and clinical factors (age, sex, duration of antibiotherapy, blood glucose, CRP, history of renal failure, history of malignancy, history of diabetes, chronic liver disease, time since onset of symptoms, and quality of myocardial suppression) as well as camera system (analog vs digital)

other_outcome.measure: Difference in the area under the curve (c-statistic) of the Duke criteria with TEE but excluding FDG-PET, with TEE and FDG-PET, and with FDG-PET but excluding TEE
Differences in sensitivity, specificity, and accuracy of FDG-PET with and without respiratory and ECG-gated acquisitions
